title: I feel sorry for Riot.
body:
This has gone too far, the board is full of unneeded complaints. I will get downvoted because I am not a hater, but fuck it. 

What in the actual fuck is all this shit? Whatever Riot does to make you fuckers happy, you get mad. 

Riot: We tried to improve.
Board: Riot never listens!!!!
Riot: No, really we are...
Board: LIEA
Riot: "Nerfs Akali" See you got what you wanted.
Board: AKALI OP OP OP OP OP OP!!!!
Riot: Ok, whatever.

The board has become one big meme at this point, so I will put it as Memes and Games. To think, I actually defended this shit hole. People are terrible.

replies.body:
Dont give them sympathy lmao. They havent listened to the community once. For the past year since pre-season 8, almost everyone complained about damage being too high. Yet here we are today, getting one shot by literally everyone still. Where a Janna W does 25% of your health. Give me one instance where they actually listened to player feedback. The only one I can bring up, is when they wanted to make Yasuos R do stupid high damage, but everyone complained so they reverted it.

What the community mostly asked for:

* Damage Nerfs
* Less Snowballing
* Akali Shroud Nerfs
* Runes Reforged Nerfs
* Bringing back old Runes
* Nerfing Conqueor
* Nerfing Yasuo/Zed/Jax/Irelia
* Nerfing Junglers so they dont gank 24/7
* Reverting Ignite
* Reverting Teleport
* A New Sorcery Keystone for actual mages to use
* Nerf Duskblade
* Nerf/Remove StormRazor
* Nerf Lethality
* Less coin flip games
* Better matchmaking system
* Removal of Autofill
* Removal of Duo queue, making it only solo queue

And a lot more was asked for from the community. Not that I 100% agree with all these things, but these were the biggest ones that stuck out from what I saw everyday. But I still have yet to see Riot address anything mentioned here, so I dont get where youre getting this " Whatever Riot does to make you fuckers happy, you get mad." stuff. No wonder the community gets mad, Riot hasnt done anything they asked.
Irelia and Akali Shroud got nerfed. Remove those. Runes Reforged got nerfed some patches ago, remove that as well (also goes with damage needs).

Akali shroud got nerfed early game with a C/D change.

**NOT WHAT THE COMMUNITY ASKED FOR.**

Irelia got changed and most recently a 5 MS Nerf. She's not bitched about nearly as much but Riot has ignored **IRELIA MAINS**, asking for changes to the champion to make her feel more balanced for both the player and opponent and Riot has done nothing.

Now irelia is still basically low elo pubstomp memes but pretty much worthless as a competitive pick. This is also not what the community wanted, they wanted damage nerfs.

Runes nerfs never occurred, at least not wide scale enough to matter. I have no idea what you're going on about. Damage is higher than it's ever been. There's literally video after video circulating Reddit of ridiculous one-shots. Go watch a synapse video it's fucking stupid.

League players want season 3-4 back. Where a tank was tanky because they bought armor and could only really lose to an ADC, where it didn't require giving every tank and bruiser retard damage reduction stats (Irelia W, Akali shroud is basically damage reduction) to allow them to even play the game.

Things like Sion, Ornn W, lissandra w/ Aftershock, etc. Are what people are trying to get you to understand, they are a counter mechanic to the stupid high damage values in the game and that's why they **also** feel so absurd when you play against them.

tbh, treat others the way you want to be treated. Riot may have treated us like shit, but we should be the better side. If we treat them fairly, respectfully, and kindly it will give them the only option to treat us the same way. It will also make our future complaints look legitimate, because 75% of the stuff I see are from players who do not play, or right out trolls for click bait. I am also sure that we agree with the same things.

Bruisers do not oneshot, but they sure as hell do way too much for so little risk. Jax, Urgot, you know what I mean.

The Yasuo buff thing was Riot trolling during April. They never wanted that buff, it never even hit PBE and was even write as a troll by Riot. I just found it funny, how people reacted towards it.

Janna is garbage at the moment, I rarely see her, but when I do, its usual a win for me. The 25% of your health is even a massive stretch, maybe 10% but that is when your ahead. The only time, I see a Janna doing damge, is when I play ARAM.

Riot Games is not defined by its staff, but its community. The way there community acts, is the way they act. Trust me, Riot does respond on the Deve, they just do not want to talk directly on the board for the fear of being shamed by the whole community over a small thing. I will bet you 100$, if they try to tell you why Akali's shroud is actually balanced and how to counter it, a shit storm of anger will fly towards them with disagreement and disappointment. Riot is filled with good people, who want to help, but the community is too aggressive. I told a Rioter once, that his effort will not solve anything other than creating more hatred. I believe he had good intentions, but the community will fight it with smears. 

Epic Games, forgot the game wtf, only step on it because the game is still young and they sure as hell have not keep the petal down for 9 years. Riot is over working, season 7, 8, and probably season 9 will prove it. At this time, yes, they need all the sympathy we can give them, because they have been working none stop for 9 years to reach expectations.

Basically, you want better change? Be responsible for what is asked for, because you may like it and a couple thousand, but we are talking about millions of players who will be affected by the end of the day.

Thanks for the comment.

GL HF

ill be honest with you man there are loads to reasons why this is happening. TLDR at bottom (please at least read it)

one of them is a extreme lack of communication. rioters rarely say anything at all anymore aside from the big red posts that happen every once in a while.
****
another is lack of action. some things stay stupidly strong and to the opposite of the scale nearly unplayable for very long periods of time.

not to mention the whole dynamic que thing, where they forced us into it when we said we dint want it, then when we said we dint like it and wanted a revert to solo/duo and ranked 5's back they told us we would get it. then did nothing, and told us it was still coming. the entire year. it did not happen till next season.
****
another is lack of listening to feedback aside from skins. i understand the gameplay teams(s) are separate from the art team(s).

unless some things are clearly out of line (which happens a lot and im not sure why) the community at large gives it a good chance. but once this this is over and its stated that the change is problematic or worse then what we had before they just dont really do anything.
****

a REALLY big one is damage and mobility creep. when it comes down to it the game has gotten more and more damage added into it through various means. the thing isnt instead of nerfing things that are too strong, they're buffing things up to their levels. over and over again.
 (other than supports which seem to have the opposite problem. of everything being nerfed around them then being nerfed for still being able to do their job)
****

we're almost at the end now. change for the sake of change.

i can can understand why this happens but the result never works out.
now im not saying riot can achieve perfect balance for their game (which frankly is a pipe dream and in their best interests not to) but they should aim for at least a somewhat good balance.

champs often get changed just because theyre not the most played. their kit might not even be problematic or oppressive or their visuals outdated but they get reworked or receive some weird change that causes of problems for players(losing their main, losing a playstyle etc) or outright make them too strong which leads into my next bit.

buffs and nerfs that are out of line happen way more often than they should. champs that are otherwise fine (or strong but not top pick) in the meta will get buffed alot to make them be able to compete with with the top picks. rather than just nerfing the top picks.
****
and finally. they never admit they messed up. we can point out all the problems with something, how bad it was to implement for everyone involved, how it shouldnt have been shipped to live how it was etc etc. but they dont seem to actually take any of it in.
its frustrating.
****

TLDR: riot fails to communicate much at all, reacts at a mind numbingly slow pace to balance, often ignores feedback aside from skins, change for the sake of change, lack of ability to admit fault. 

all of these lead to being frustrated, and we've only been getting more and more frustrated over the years.
eventually you see that calm discussion isnt working, so you begin to switch to outrage at the hopes of getting **_something_** across.
Your TLDR is correct. You are upvoted.
why u not get banned for using swear words
They are trying, but just that, trying.

Never said that or even though that way. Whatever made you come to that conclusion, you need to find out why. I merely stated that many people say, Riot does not listen, when in fact, they do. But when they make that change people wanted, people get pissed anyway. You see what I mean?

They have nerfed Akali countless times as of this moment and planning another one for the next patch, which concludes that Riot does, in fact, listen. But people will again complain that she will be too strong regardless and will post about how Riot still did not listen. Because CT and people do not want to use brain power to figure out how to counter his champions other than gutting them, because it is definitely not easier to learn to play against them than to get them nerfed. It stupid Hasinsin logic, get Riot to nerf everything that kills you because you are never at fault.

Goes 0/17/4 with a "broken" champion named Viktor, who is a counter champion to Riven. So I might ask this, who the fuck gave this man or his followers the right to tell Riot what is broken or not. Piss off.

Your initial comment said "unneeded complaints" which implies that you are making the determination that these complaints are, in fact, unneeded. That's where I got that from.

I would wager that the people who ask for a change are not the ones getting pissed when that change happens. It is more likely another subset of individuals who were against that change in the first place, and as such, not complaining about it in the first place.

They have nerfed Akali exactly twice. Not "countless times." Once in 8.18, which was a worthless change in the form of a small damage reduction to her ultimate. Then again in 8.22, a full SEVEN patches after her rework debuted in 8.15.

I'm not even going to argue about CT. I can see both sides of the argument here. On one hand, there are surely ways to deal with his champions. On the other, they tend to be extremely toxic to play against, even when you have the proper circumstances to go against them. If you don't, then you're just straight up fucked.

The real problem, at least for me, is that Riot's philosophy is in direct contradiction with a lot of the playerbase, and a massive number of people have quit this game because of this. They even acknowledged that they understand damage is too high...but have done NOTHING about it. Sure, they sometimes will pay attention with individual champions, or items...but they don't seem to grasp the bigger picture here. That is a huge problem. And, honestly, I fully believe they deserve a lot of the flak they get.

I understand your logic, but where you get me saying "unneeded complaints" is yet to be seen. Should Riot be held accountable, yes, of course, but for the most part its the same dumb complaint over and over, either about a subject that is entirely not there fault, or its just delete, nerf, delete, nerf with no substance as to how they could fix it.
You can only get things your way, IF you specify, why you are right. Instead, I see rant post. So is the flak justifiable? No.

Else, I get what you say, and I agree.

BTW, unimportant but, you are really good at writing fast without mess ups. TEACH ME!!!

Ha, thanks for the compliment. Sometimes things are just clear. Other times not as much.

Regarding the "unneeded complaints," it is literally in the first sentence of your OP.

Lastly, I can understand where you're coming from when mentioning rants and raves. Perhaps they should be more constructive, but you have to remember that a lot of these same complaints have been floating around for years. Eventually there comes a breaking point where people just get fed up, and some people lose their patience. Then there are those, like Hashinshin, with ridiculous claims and standards... However, I think that's a bad example, as he's probably playing a character.

Fuck me, just saw the "unneeded complaints" part on my post. I am surprised, I did not even remember that. Maybe, I just got fed up of all the complaints that I wrote a complaint. Lol
> This has gone too far, the board is full of unneeded complaints. 

I do not think I have the right to tell anyone, what is unneeded or needed. I just wish people would have a little more sympathy for a company that at least want to change and want to do the right thing. And I do understand the build-up frustration, but even a company as big as Riot Games, will not be able to keep up at times. Sometimes there is no solution and Riot probably stated that back in the day, they may have to rewrite some of those unchangeable requests to keep people informed about what can and cannot be changed.

Sorry for my rude behavior, I respect and thank you for your comments.

GL HF

I feel like riot doesn't put enough thought into the actual abilities these champions have. Neeko seems 100% fine and refreshing not seeing a completely overloaded champion. But akali, irel and Zoe are basically required to be gutter trash winrate because of how unreasonably they have been designed. Same with azir, ryze, kalista, etc. Riot never learns from their mistakes. Just a cycle of release overloaded champion->abused in pro-play->nerfed into ground-> release overloaded champion....

Sure, a massive Q burst with overloaded CC on the ultimate and E. Neeko is beyond terrible in design. Zoe right now is at a balanced state, I have even proven it and debunked several posts against Zoe. Zoe or should I say, all of CT's champions, depends on the player putting time and effort into the kit. The funny thing is, Ryse is almost the same, but his W is point-click which sets his balancing off the road. Changing Ryze's W would make him so much easier to balance, else his kit is well designed.

Neeko will be like Azir, too much to offer with minimal risk. Neeko will be doing burst with her Q, E, and Ultimate while being slippier than Zoe. Neeko also has an unfair amount of CC that is too strong for her already bursty kit. She has a strong wave clear with her Q, W, and E. Nothing about Neeko is well designed, or well thought out. She will go through the same treatment as Azir, Riot will be gutting her till she is pointless to use.
I can, however, see a way out of this.
Take off the burst damage from Neekos ultimate and E (her E should still do some damage, but not overwhelming.), and add it to her Q which will do more damage per tick. This will, justify her W and her, unreal amount of CC. 
Neeko is an unfinished product, I see what they want, but they can do so much better. And, I am confident that Neeko will take Akalis place as the most banned champion when she is released. Neeko is absurd, how some people think she is balanced is surprising to me.


Akali is a fucking free win, why is she still a problem? The only thing needed is to increase her CD on her W and increase her execute damage. Punishing an Akali player for using her shroud to regain energy is a perfect design from CT's part, the Balance Team just need to do their job. Make her W lot more punishable, by setting her W CD permanent through all levels.

Every champion you mentioned is well designed, just not balanced in the way that would make them. Azir and Neeko are the only two exceptions of a child creating a champion. "I gain god, power." "But then I gain god killer power, and overthrow you." "Then I gain anti-god killer power, and overpower you." "But then I..." and it can go on.

Thanks for your thoughts.

GL HF
